newsitem.title: JAPAN: Typhoon Peter heads for southern Japan.
newsitem.headline: Typhoon Peter heads for southern Japan.

text.p: Typhoon Peter moved northeast across the East China Sea on Friday and headed for southern Japan, weather officials said.
With peak winds of 108 kph (68 mph), Peter triggered flood warnings and caused the cancellation of a dozen domestic flights in southern Japan.
A week ago, Typhoon Opal killed one person and disrupted air, rail and road traffic when it stormed through central Japan.
"This is a very unusual phenomenon. It is the first time two typhoons have threatened Japan's home islands in June since records began in 1951," a Meteorological Agency spokesman said.
Peter's strong winds and torrential rains hit the southern island of Okinawa on Friday and may land on the southernmost main island of Kyushu on Saturday, the spokesman said.
The agency issued flash flood warnings throughout southern and central Japan, including Tokyo, due to heavy rains forecast in the wake of Typhoon Peter.
